item.title: The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1
item.description:
The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1

How a 29-year-old idealist built a global drug bazaar and became a murderous kingpin.

item.title: Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius
item.description:
Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius

Karl Ove Knausgård, a Norwegian now domiciled with his wife and four kids in Sweden, is perhaps the world's most revered living writer. Only, if he were American, the principal thing he and everyone else would say about him is that he is an alcoholic.

item.title: KING: Why the 'War on Drugs' is really a war on black people
item.description:
KING: Why the 'War on Drugs' is really a war on black people

Last week I spoke at Dillard University, a historically black college in New Orleans. About 400 students crowded into the auditorium. At one point, I asked students to raise their hand if they had a friend or family member currently in jail or prison. Nearly every hand was raised.

item.title: Luton drug dealer who was caught with large amount of LSD-type drugs at music festival jailed
item.description:
Luton drug dealer who was caught with large amount of LSD-type drugs at music festival jailed

A drug dealer who was caught with £1,400 worth of an LSD-type substance at a Northamptonshire music festival has been sentenced to three years in jail. Lewis Brown, aged 21, of Summerfield Road, Luton, was stopped by security as he tried to enter the Illusive music event in Deene Park, Northamptonshire, on September 11 last year.

item.title: Breakup Brain: Getting Over a Lost Lover is Like Quitting Drugs, Says Neuroscientist
item.description:
Breakup Brain: Getting Over a Lost Lover is Like Quitting Drugs, Says Neuroscientist

Dr. Lucy Brown is annoyed with Ben Brantley. Why would a clinical professor of neurology at Albert Einstein College of Medicine in the Bronx have an issue with a New York Times theater critic? Because in Mr. Brantley's review this week of The Effect , a play about falling in love while taking antidepressants, he writes that "emotions cannot be quantified, particularly love."

item.title: How Decriminalizing Drugs Could Reduce Islamic Terrorism in France and Belgium | VICE | United States
item.description:
How Decriminalizing Drugs Could Reduce Islamic Terrorism in France and Belgium | VICE | United States

Tuesday's horrific attacks in Brussels, which killed at least 31 people and left well over 200 injured, have brought shock and soul-searching. At publication time two brothers, Khalid and Ibrahim el-Bakraoui, were named as the suicide bombers who struck at a metro station and airport respectively, while a third suspect, Najim Laachraoui, was still being sought in a major manhunt.

item.title: Sergeant thought Ms Dhu was faking illness, inquest told
item.description:
Sergeant thought Ms Dhu was faking illness, inquest told

Posted March 23, 2016 17:55:39 A former police sergeant has told an inquest he believed a dying Aboriginal woman was "coming down from drugs" and "faking illness" to try to get out of the cells at the South Hedland police station.

item.title: Ozarks meth warning: Your drugs may be contaminated, so bring them in for testing
item.description:
Ozarks meth warning: Your drugs may be contaminated, so bring them in for testing

The Christian County Sheriff's Department posted a notice on Facebook about the potential hazard. Bring your meth on down to be screened, the department said. Contaminated meth reportedly will be collected by trained officers.

item.title: 10 homes raided in Cumbria police drugs operation
item.description:
10 homes raided in Cumbria police drugs operation

FOUR people have been arrested as part of a drugs operation in west Cumbria. Police are executing warrants at 10 properties across the area as part of Operation Phoenix today. An ounce of heroin, worth around £3,000, 25g of amphetamine with a street value of over £500, 20g of cannabis worth £200 and stolen goods were seized during the raids.

item.title: Celebrity barrister admits supplying drugs that killed his teen lover
item.description:
Celebrity barrister admits supplying drugs that killed his teen lover

Hendron had previously denied a string of drugs charges, but pleaded guilty to two charges of possessing drugs with intent to supply at the Old Bailey on Wednesday. His confession may mark the end of a glittering career for the Tory lawyer once tipped to lead the party.
